oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alvin C. York story -- Jamestown

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Drugstores; Automobiles; Banks
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; World war, 1914-1918 -- Tennessee -- History; Jamestown (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A street in Jamestown, Tennessee. Numerous cars are parked on the street in front of shops and businesses. Businesses in the background include Jamestown Soda Pharmacy, Central Drug Company Drug Store, and a bank building. It is labeled as the place where York and the film producers "made their headquarters" during the meetings about the film, "Sergeant York."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fentress County was Alvin York's home county. Photograph was taken during a meeting York had with Hollywood producers related to a proposed film, "Sergeant York," based on his World War I exploits. Photograph taken by Albert Franklin Ganier Sr., who is referred to as the "John James Audubon of Tennessee," for his ornithological photography work, captured numerous photos of the meeting between York and Warner Brothers as they researched the film.
